Cancer persists to be a major hurdle to human wellbeing causing the second-highest mortality rate after cardiovascular diseases
1 . Despite the advances in chemotherapeutic approaches, unmet clinical needs maintain cancer as a leading cause of death
2
,
3 . Furthermore, cancer is a group of heterogeneous diseases with multifactorial etiology and inevitability for resistance evolvement. These challenges along with our continuous understanding of oncogenesis suggest that a multitarget single molecule with polypharmacological mechanisms might afford a novel promising chemotherapeutic agent
4 .
